name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is Joe Biden’s pick for vice president. In July, @IsaacDovere wrote that if she were the pick, it would “probably seem like the longest, most drawn-out lead-up to an obvious conclusion in the history of modern presidential politics.” https://t.co/uNH8S3x2ir

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden’s running mate, Kamala Harris, is two decades younger than him—the potential vice presidency seems like merely a first step, @IsaacDovere writes. https://t.co/ffRHzdJlRk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pop culture can’t imagine a female vice president like Kamala Harris, @megangarber argues: https://t.co/LmH3xE5uSH

name: TheAtlantic
text: At the height of its popularity, in 2012, Anonymous had been a network of thousands of activists, but it had since largely faded from view. But now Anonymous is back, with a new generation eager to join, @DaleBeran writes. https://t.co/PE4rmeOxXJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If Republicans wanted to limit voter turnout and raise doubts about the election’s integrity, creating chaos within the Postal Service and undermining its independence would be an efficient way to pursue that goal," Winifred Gallagher writes: https://t.co/5gIK1r9fuA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris will be waging her vice-presidential campaign within a culture that is happy to allow women their place—as long as they know their place. @megangarber writes: https://t.co/DyU54I3hFW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is officially the Democratic vice-presidential candidate. @PeterBeinart writes that Harris’s tough-on-crime record says “less about her than about the country in which she lived.”  https://t.co/7cywMBiaBU

name: TheAtlantic
text: As the co-founder of an NYC tutoring company, @bplatzer has been fielding calls every day from desperate parents struggling to figure out how to help their kids this school year and wondering whether they should set up a pod. This is what he tells them: https://t.co/g1Zg1Jtg24

name: TheAtlantic
text: "It is a bit disorienting to wake up early expecting to go out for a walk, and find that you have been personally targeted for sanctions by the most powerful authoritarian state in the world," @abramowitz writes: https://t.co/riKQdKc66d

name: TheAtlantic
text: Twenty years after her moment in the Hollywood spotlight, @amandafortini writes, the famed environmental activist Erin Brockovich has not slowed down. https://t.co/okT4XFaYLM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Teachers discuss whether it’s safe to reopen schools this fall, via @TheAtlLetters: https://t.co/57BdBUVJ2u
